server.connection

Class ProxyServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.connection.ProxyServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, SharedProxyServer

    public final class ProxyServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements SharedProxyServer

    This class implements SharedProxyServer and all its methods, making them interact with the correct controller components (if they are local) or routing them with the correct parameters to the client (if they are remote)


    This class implements the singleton design pattern, having just one instance of it available per JVM; this instance can be accessed through the static class' methods.


    This class holds both a NetworkRmi and a NetworkSocket static references, constructed as servers.

    Finally, the private attribute Boolean test is used to determine whether this class should be used in a testing environment: this means that some methods which try to use a connection will instead fallback to a mock

    See Also:
    SharedProxyServer, Connection

      • startGame

        public java.lang.String startGame(java.lang.String uuid,
                                  java.lang.String nick,
                                  java.lang.String ip,
                                  java.lang.Integer port,
                                  java.lang.Boolean isSocket,
                                  java.rmi.Remote stub)
        Local
        This method is called whenever a player asks to register on the server; moreover, if that player connected using RMI, its remote reference (passed as the stub parameter) is exported on the registry. The player is then registered binding all its configuration parameters to its Unique User ID
        Specified by:
        startGame in interface SharedProxyServer
        Parameters:
        uuid - see SharedProxyClient for more about the first parameter
        nick - String
        ip - String
        port - Integer
        isSocket - Boolean
        stub - Remote
        Returns:
        server's response to the client's registration request
        See Also:
        SharedProxyServer.startGame(String, String, String, Integer, Boolean, Remote)

      • printScore

        public void printScore(java.lang.String uuid,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nicks,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> scores,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> winner)
        Remote
        Specified by:
        printScore in interface SharedProxyServer
        Parameters:
        uuid - see SharedProxyClient for more about the first parameter
        nicks - list of player nicknames, alphabetically ordered (from 1 to 4 players can have played a match)
        scores - list of player scores, ordered with respect to nicknames
        winner - list of boolean flags, ordered with respect to nicknames (multiple players may have the winner flag set, if they have the same final score)
        See Also:
        SharedProxyServer.printScore(String, ArrayList, ArrayList, ArrayList)
